questions.question: What are the various sources of information that you project and others project at the table that convey information?
Anyway, what are hand ranges, and how do you begin to estimate the range of hands that your opponents have?
In general, how hard is it to lay down a really strong hand, just psychologically?
So is bluffing in that context essentially misrepresenting the range of hands that you have?
So like in a tournament, how quickly can you construct a player profile that you've never played before?
So you say, okay, well, I could have this, I could have this, I actually have this, right?
But is there some aspect of belief in the magic of this hand manifests quality of play?
Do you remember there was times in your life, speaking of resilience, that were extremely difficult to you mentally?
Is there some, at the highest level of play, is there still a role for feel?
Like is Tiger Woods having fun when he's like on 17 about to win a major?
Now this is tough because you're a humble guy, but objectively speaking, can you say what your strengths are?
Is there somebody like that that stands out to you as a potential GOAT status person?
Is it gonna take time to figure out who, you know, stands the test of time?
How hard is it to win the main event of the World Series of Poker?
The term for that that, you know, kids use is ICM, independent, you know, chip model, right?
Since we talked about online a bit, is it possible to cheat in poker, especially online?
So when an event happens, the event itself is neither good or bad until you assign it value, right?
